Crash Drive 2 is a fun racing game with a neat multiplayer built-in. Racing is easy, enjoyable, the maps are big and there are really only minor flaws which shouldn't break your gameplay experience.Enough talk, let's get to the pros and cons:Pros: A nice cartoonish art style A lot of game modes and areas Many different vehicles with different advantages and disadvantages Random events occur in mid-game that encourage players to compete Levels are huge and even include secret areas! System requirements are low. No more problems with friends with bad computers! This game also supports Linux and MacOS, which is a huge plus for some people Full controller support Trading Cards, achievements and even leaderboards! It's cheap + you get an extra copy when you buy the game!Cons: You can fall off the map. They tried to make it fun with an achievement, but this is still not a nice bug. It's not a big deal, though. The graphic menu is really hard to reach. At first, I didn't think there even are any options for graphics. Then I found that there are written instructions on how to change the resolution and quality. After you press "Play" on Steam, you have to hold the Shift button until the menu appears. It is a classic Unity graphics menu, which is fine. There is only one option to upgrade the car: to the highest level. There are literally two options: normal and maximally upgraded. However, upgrading cars is not the point of the game. No biggie. Camera angles can sometimes be a bit funny as you can't control your point of view with your mouse. But only happens when you are making sudden 180° turns.The final verdict:The point of this game is not to be mentally fulfilled and inspired, but to have fun. And this is really well done. The only thing I missed is easy access to the graphic menu, but you really only need to do that once. Once I have set things up properly, there were no game-breaking bugs or anything illogical happening. I can see myself playing this for a lot of hours. The community is active right now and I hope it doesn't start to lose players.Greetings,BirdCuteNote that my copy of this game was obtained for free for reviewing purposes. However, this did not affect the quality and objectivity of this review.---If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: Follow Original Curator Group

												Just finished playing this game to completion (upgrading all cars, etc), and I have to say it was pretty cool.Items of note for you who are interested:• It's an online game - you connet to servers (JP, EU or US based on your locale), so ultimately it's a multiplayer, like a simple version of Trackmania or similar.• Graphically, it's not going to blow your socks off [mobile port I believe], but it makes up for that in charm, with 30 different vehicles, each with their own characteristics (engine sounds, horns, boost effects, handling).• While only 4 tracks, and a tank battle level, there are various things you do in each one, from collecting coins, accumulating stunt points, racing, tagging objects, find the ring, and king of the crown, it doesn't get too boring if you like to be competitive, and in there to enjoy the game.• No in level or lobby for chat! Recommended game - 2-pack for $5 is a no-brainer - dive in with a mate, and get playing!

												Don't get fooled by the positive reviews like i was. Everything about this game is very shallow.There are 4 worlds(maps), but they aren't very big at all, they are actually rather small and the first world(Canyon) is actually rather tiny.There are 30 cars, but they are all pretty much the same with next to NO diffrence in stats (There are no stats, all of the cars control the same except the later cars are sligtly faster then the beggining cars).The only car stats is that the cars are devided in three categories: Light, Medium, Heavy. The problem is that they all control the same with the only difference being that the Light cars are a slightly faster, the Heavy cars are a slightly better at stunting and the Medium ones are somewhere in the middle(aleast from what i have seen, this is never explained in-game).The mechanics are shallow. You can only do backflips, frontflips and move the car left or right doing 180, 360, 720 and 1080 turns midair(sorry, i don't know whats the real name of that trick if it even has one). The cars fly around on even the slightest bump and that can get annoying.There are 6 minigames(events) that happen randomly in the game but most are very shallow. Here is why:1. Find the ring event: There are always a few rings in every world, and when this event starts one of those rings turns blue and you have to get to it first in order to win. The problem is that the player who is closest to the ring will probably win (unless the closest player makes some stupid mistake) so its completly luck based.2. Racing event: All you have to do is go thru all of the checkpoints to win. The problem is that ALL of these races take place on the flat terrain on the maps instead of useing any of the many props in the worlds so they are rather boring.But the BIGGEST problem is that ALL of these races are very short, they last around 30 to 40 seconds. That happens because, again, the worlds are rather small.3. Tag event: You have to stunt on as many of the props(and thus ''tag'' them) and you have to have the most props tagged before time runs out in order to win.This event isn't actually all that bad. It makes sense that such an event exists since this game has alot of focus on stunting.The only problem is that 2/4 worlds have specific places that you kinda have to go to in order to win cause they are filled with props.4. Stunt event: Get the most amount of points by stunting before time ends.This isn't HORRIBLE, but its shallow because you can easily win most of the matches by just doing the same stunt over and over again.5. King of the crown: A random player gets the crown and has to keep it for 60 seconds to win, and the other players can win by hitting the player with the crown so they can take it.It sounds good on paper but because of the mechanics and the fact that on even the slightest bump your car flyes around, it can be a pain sometimes to hit the guy with the crown, and 50% of the time the guy who randomly gets the crown at the start is the one who wins.6. Coin collect event: Collect the most amount of coins before the time ends to win.This one is completly fine, no real problems with it.There are some bugs, most aren't all that annoying except the bug where you clip thru a prop and usually you are stuck there then you have to re-enter the world, thus you lose the event.There is usually more then enough players in the game playing so don't ever enter an empty server(but sometimes when you are not playing at peak hours there won't be more then 6 players on any server).There is no way to comunicate with other players.The graphics are mobile tier(thats because this is a port of the mobile version of the game), but thats not important. What IS important is the sound, and the sounds are OK, but the music gets repetitive.There is also a seprate Tank Battle mode, but its nohing special. You start with the regular tank, you can buy 4 diffrent tank that all have diffrent stats(Yes, the tanks have actual stats).You have around 5 VERY tiny areas that are in the sky, and the way you win is by shooting another player so that he flys out of the area and then that gets counted as a kill (yes, you just push them, they don't actually explode).As you may see, the Tank Battle mode isn't all that great and there are other games (and mods for other games) that do a better job, but its not bad. Its OK.But do you want to know the BIGGEST problem with the game? The game can be played for FREE on Android/Iphone AND it can be played for free on the web browser! So this game, even with the free copy, isn't worth 1 euro, let alone 5 ♥♥♥♥ING EUROS.

												It's like the poor man's version of something like The Crew and that's not a bad thing!. A mostly open world map where you play on 5 different maps along with other people also playing the game on that same map. You start off with the first and last levels, the latter being a tank versus map. to progress you must perform certain stunts to reach rings to collect them, get a certain amount of points, and win a few events. Events consist of racing, taging ramps and other objects to color them while keeping hold of them by getting big scores off of them, collecting coins, performing stunts and getting the highest score, a sort of tag mode where you must keep the crown away from others or get it yourself and get your timer to zero to win, and a find the ring event where you must look for the ring that you must reach first to win. There are various cars to win and unlock by raising your player level and maxing out your cars' levels, 4 that are unlocked by beating the vehicles in a race on your own (1v1). Each vehicle has four stats: Top Speed- raised by simply staying at the top speed for an extended amount of time, Acceleration- raised by just accelerating, Handling- raised by drifting, and Nitro- raised by using your boost. Once you reach the required player level and amount of cars' stats maxed out, which you can buy out depending on how much progress was made, you use the in game cash to buy the vehicle for use.I highly recommend this game to any racing game fans or anyone just looking for some good clean fun! It's cheap and comes with an extra copy to share with a friend. A game that deserves a look, go ahead buy it!

												You know when Keanu Reeves always says "whoa"? I think he must have been looking at an early copy of this game.I had no idea what to expect when I threw this in my cart just to raise my order level a couple of bucks. I love racing games; and the description sounded good. The idea of it being multi-player with random events almost turned me off; mostly because I think online multi-player does nothing but bring up the worst possible players in games...not to mention I wasn't worried about doing anything but driving cars.Well, let me just say my mind was changed as soon as I started playing the game. The levels are in fact open, just not quite as large as you might be made to think. Still, there are tons of physics and gravity defying stuff you can do. Sure, events pop up randomly and you're automatically put in competition...but you're not forced to actually do anything. You can keep driving around doing your own thing, completely ignoring the fact there's an event going on. But the events are somewhat fun and sometimes trying to complete and win those involves a lot of driving around. You aren't forced to join actual races though; just events that continue to work in sandbox mode.There are a lot of various cars, and you do have to level them up. You have the option of buying a max level; but I wouldn't do it. Leveling the cars up to max doesn't take very long; I was able to level several cars to max in less than the 3 hours I first played; for the most part driving the car around will help you boost it's four areas. Drifting maxes your handling ability, using nitro obviously boosts your nitro ability, actual acceleration increases your acceleration rating, and driving at top speed maxes out your top-speed rating. Just driving around doing drifts for 20 or 30 minutes in a car will get it's level quite high. Save your money for buying cars as you unlock them.I still can't get over how addictively fun this game is. The controls of the car are quite simple...and in a way remind me of a lot of the other simple racers. You don't have 4000 controls you need to memorize to drive the thing, just a few basic commands and a lot of fun arcade-type handling. There seems to be plenty of stuff to do; although if the events aren't your deal...the levels may get boring after a while. Still, for even the non-sale price; it's worth picking up a copy. I love it.  I just bought Stranded Deep and thought I was going to be playing that for the next 6 months; but this one might give it a run for it's money.You should be warned though; you appear to be playing with users of the mobile version as well; which has several hacks and cheats available for it; so I highly suspect some users aren't playing honestly.

												Crash Drive 2 is a disappointing multiplayer game, with repetitive and uninteresting gameplay that is driven entirely by a hollow unlockable/level-up system that sets it down a tragic path that diverges from the fundamental gameplay aspects of it's predecessor, Crash Drive 1.     The gameplay is only half decent, and it relies entirely on levelling up and unlocking new vehicles. Each vehicle is only unique in appearance, since after maxing their levels (which is very easy) they all have virtually the exact same stats. This results in the player having to unlock many, many cars that he/she truly doesn't like or care about until they eventually unlock their favorite car--or maybe even unlock them all--at which point he/she has no reason to ever play with the other cars or really even play the game ever again. This is especially frustrating because the first installment of Crash Drive had totally unique cars with very different stats, and I found myself frequently switching between cars simply for fun. In Crash Drive 2, however, switching between cars is merely a chore that is necessary to continue the unlocking process.      I also found the multiplayer only state of the game to be tedious, since my favorite part of the first Crash Drive game was the solitude of it, doing insane tricks like a child in a sandbox all by yourself without being bothered by anybody. It was peaceful and relaxing, whereas Crash Drive 2's multiplayer focus is almost annoying. Suddenly, the game is all about competition, which ruins what I always thought was the most fundamental part of Crash Drive: the casual gameplay.I respect Crash Drive 2 for it's ambition, for trying to become something bigger and better, but I don't think the game achieves what it attempts to.     The only saving grace of this game is Tank Battles, which is actually pretty fun and unique. I found it very entertaining for a bit, but it gets boring after not to long. I can't imagine I'll ever return to this game--not for tank battles, and especially not for the main game. After putting this game down, all I can say is that the whole game felt like a job: it kept me playing with the stupid unlockable system, but it never truly entertained me like the first game did. Crash Drive 2 was nothing but a waste of time to me. I disliked the game so much that I can't even imagine giving my free gift copy to a friend, lest I subject them to an equally negative experience.Overall Rating = 3.3/10 I want my time back

												The Pros:If you like cartoony racing games buy this one. It has very smooth controls and is easy for even young kids to be competitive due to the ability to manuever vehicle in air (which also allows for tricks which is a fun part of the game). The graphics and models all fit the theme and even though they and the particle effects are store bought "packs" you don't mind because the maps are well crafted and the vehicles are very pleasing to look at.Each vehicle handles differently and each is fun to play but none seem to be over powered and even the lower vehicles easily compete with the higher level. Unlike most racing theme games where the lobby sits empty due to poor multiplayer session design; Crash Drive 2 allows players to drive around in a open world map levelling, gaing cash, and stunt driving until the racing, collecting, stunting, etc matches begin. This keep players in the servers between "matches" and helps with the empty sever problem of other games. You can also join servers where your friends are at using the box on the Play screen!Don't be put off about the poor reviews of input controls, the game uses the arrow keys for driving and ctl and space for nitros and brake.. drop the mouse (it does nothing in game) and use your right hand on the arrow keys and left for nitros/brake.. it is very intuitive and feels quite natural and arcade like.    The cash gathering, vehicle levelling, player levelling, and map levelling all make for a good balance of stuff to do that keeps you occupied between events and the progression seems about right imho.There is no chat so you can safely let your kids play without worry about filters, you will also have a more pleasant time not getting into trash talking matches (which could also be a con...)Now for the CONS:Cheating happens in this type of game. In about 1 out of 5 play sessions you will run into a cheater who uses some hack to beat an event. In the Capture the Crown event there is a hack that allows the crown wearer to instantly end the event and win or using map glitches to hide under ground. In the Stunt Point event and Stunt Tag event several map hacks allow for assinine scores at times. I have never been affected by cheating in the racing events, Ring Grab,  or Coin collection events that I noticed. However, except in the case of the hacks that prematurely end the event you can usually  get a coin earning place since there is usually only one player cheating and sometimes their hack kicks them and you get first if you didn't give up. The free flowing point/cash earning design of the game keeps these POS hackers from ruining the game but they are aggravating and need to be addressed. You can also simply quit and rejoin and get a new server away from the hacker. But like most hackers.. most of them bore easily and few stay long.There are some menu problems, you have to QUIT the garage to change maps/servers join friends server... this feels very counter intuitive to pretty much all other racing games where you go to the map FROM the garage!Your mouse cursor will occassionally disappear for no reason in menus and you will have to swing mouse around till you get lucky and get over button... sometimes you can hit escape to back to prior menu where cursor exists.Final thought: Buy it, get your free gift game, and get playing!

												The Pros:If you like cartoony racing games buy this one. It has very smooth controls and is easy for even young kids to be competitive due to the ability to manuever vehicle in air (which also allows for tricks which is a fun part of the game). The graphics and models all fit the theme and even though they and the particle effects are store bought "packs" you don't mind because the maps are well crafted and the vehicles are very pleasing to look at.Each vehicle handles differently and each is fun to play but none seem to be over powered and even the lower vehicles easily compete with the higher level. Unlike most racing theme games where the lobby sits empty due to poor multiplayer session design; Crash Drive 2 allows players to drive around in a open world map levelling, gaing cash, and stunt driving until the racing, collecting, stunting, etc matches begin. This keep players in the servers between "matches" and helps with the empty sever problem of other games. You can also join servers where your friends are at using the box on the Play screen!Don't be put off about the poor reviews of input controls, the game uses the arrow keys for driving and ctl and space for nitros and brake.. drop the mouse (it does nothing in game) and use your right hand on the arrow keys and left for nitros/brake.. it is very intuitive and feels quite natural and arcade like.    The cash gathering, vehicle levelling, player levelling, and map levelling all make for a good balance of stuff to do that keeps you occupied between events and the progression seems about right imho.There is no chat so you can safely let your kids play without worry about filters, you will also have a more pleasant time not getting into trash talking matches (which could also be a con...)Now for the CONS:Cheating happens in this type of game. In about 1 out of 5 play sessions you will run into a cheater who uses some hack to beat an event. In the Capture the Crown event there is a hack that allows the crown wearer to instantly end the event and win or using map glitches to hide under ground. In the Stunt Point event and Stunt Tag event several map hacks allow for assinine scores at times. I have never been affected by cheating in the racing events, Ring Grab,  or Coin collection events that I noticed. However, except in the case of the hacks that prematurely end the event you can usually  get a coin earning place since there is usually only one player cheating and sometimes their hack kicks them and you get first if you didn't give up. The free flowing point/cash earning design of the game keeps these POS hackers from ruining the game but they are aggravating and need to be addressed. You can also simply quit and rejoin and get a new server away from the hacker. But like most hackers.. most of them bore easily and few stay long.There are some menu problems, you have to QUIT the garage to change maps/servers join friends server... this feels very counter intuitive to pretty much all other racing games where you go to the map FROM the garage!Your mouse cursor will occassionally disappear for no reason in menus and you will have to swing mouse around till you get lucky and get over button... sometimes you can hit escape to back to prior menu where cursor exists.Final thought: Buy it, get your free gift game, and get playing!

												A few of you might know Crash Drive 2 is originally a mobile game. Yes, but before you say "Lyra, this has nothing to do with a review of such a game!!!", yes it does. And why you ask?This PC port of this Massively Multiplayer Online racing game is another good example of a game that's much better on PC than on mobile.Suuuuuuuuuure, the mobile game is free, and I played it myself too. Just because its free doesnt mean it's a mobile game with good framerate and easy to play on the touch screen. And it does not mean there's no ads.Y'see, this PC version is extrememly fast and much easier to play. And its very compatible too. I recently played this game on a very old 2006 Windows XP computer. Here's the specs: 1GB Ram, (idk about the processor but its an old one I tell ya), NVIDIA GeForce 7300LE. For today's standards, this is a not-very-powerful-little-PC-thats-almost-10-years-old.   And guess what? My computer ran the game in 100% FPS. No lag or crap like that, on a computer that's almost 10 years old!!! On my phone, which is.... let me see... I know its taking me a while... just you wait... stupid phone... wait... oops wrong menu,,, dang it... here... "About Phone"... hmmm.... 2011. Thats right. I tried the game on my 2011 Phone, and there was lots of lag. Very annoying.... but my old PC which is less powerful than my phone, can run it better!!! That being said, the gameplay on the PC will be much more enjoyable.And when I mean "much more enjoyable", that's saying a lot, so listen! First, there's that great frame rate, I dont think I need to talk more about it. Then, there's the graphics; they're obviously better, and obvously this has nothing to do with how much you enjoy the gameplay. But seriously, the game is much easier to control because its not a touch screen where you have to worry about having big, massive and giantic fingers. Y'just use the arrows keys! And it controls the cars perfectly with not any problem. If you plug a controller, the game will automatically recognize your controller and make the game playable with it. The game plays EXTREMEMLY well with a controller, and I strongly recommend you, as much as I recommend to not play the mobile game that is 7.8 too much lag, that you use a controller. There's a thing I would like to say about the controller mode though. It does play excellent, but there is a more or less big problem. It doesnt ruin the gameplay, but it makes it slightly less fun, but dont you worry, it's an issue they'll fix in no doubt: In mid-air with a controller, you can only steer your car to the left and right. I cant steer the car fowards or backwards so that I can make a flip. This issue MUST be fixed as soon as possible. If the gas button on the controller wont steer the car in mid-air (up arrow is the gas on the keyboard, and it also steers the car fowards in mid-air), then you can program it so that if I push the analog stick up and down it'll make me steer fowards and backwards in mid-air.The in-game events are very addictive. As addictive as buying games on Steam: You dont wanna stop doing it. There is an event in which you have to collect more coins than your opponents (which are real people, remember its a MMO), another where someone has a crown and you must steal it from the current person who has it, and you gotta have the crown on you for 60 seconds.... there's a checkpoint-based (what? That's how we say it, no?) race game, a stunt contest in which you must do more points than your opponents by doing stunt, and a couple of more events. These event are, surprisingly, very competitive, believe it or not. This makes the game much more fun to play for long periods of time. Altough, you shoudln't play for so long without breaks.There are LOTS of cars to unlock and to upgrade. You upgrade the car by simply playing (Not kidding!), or you pay to upgrade it at maximum. You expect me to say more? I dont have anything else to say, its just that great.The maps are well made and very large. And you wont get bored in them, as there is lots of things to do in them. Loops, jumps, objects, rings, ramps....anything you want! I do think a level editor would be an AMAZING idea.The sound is good, nothing much to say about it.The physics arent very realistic. But, hey, who the heck cares for physics in a racing game like that? The physics are fun and well made, and that's what counts really. Realistic physics in this game would be a disaster, trust me.To conclude, you shut up and you give them your money. Its that much worth it. Happy gaming!

												I got this for a buck with a coupon, but after playing for awhile I wouldn't mind paying the full price.  It also comes with 2 copies so you can play with a friend.  It seems to play like Tony Hawk with cars.  Every 30 seconds, a new challenge starts which vary between racing, king of the hill, tagging, and competing for the highest score.  In the mean time, you have to drive through rings that are scattered all over the maps, and npc's that you cxan challenge to unlock their cars.  You also level up your cars as you use them, and unlock more just from playing.  The controls are a bit wonky, which just adds to the flavor, and I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a fun casual game to play.

												A really good game. Its just 5 bucks and you also get a free copy to gift within the price. Its very funny to play alone but even funnier with friends. There are 2 modes you could say: 1st there is a free-roam mode where you go around on the map and have your fun driving around and wait for missions to participate in which you can get money from. 2nd is the tank mode where you can choose between 5 types of tanks which all have their pros and cons. You have to score "kills" (shoot players off the platform) to get points and whoever has most of them at the end of the round wins it. I absolutely love this game and i would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a fun game that doesn't cost too much.
